timeline.bodyText: So... the synchronizations are not needed because BINDINGS is modified only during the class initialization itself (at least, with the current code). Right?
timeline.author: aaime

replies.bodyText:
Hi @aaime yes, I think the commit message states it pretty clearly, let me know if it's confusing anyhow so I can rephrase:
GeoTools.scanForSystemHints() synchronizes on its static
BINDINGS variable, which is only modified during the class'
static initialization. The method is side-effect free and
only mutates the argument object, hence there's no need
to synchronize on this field.
replies.author: groldan

replies.bodyText: well,  GeoTools.scanForSystemHints(final Map<RenderingHints.Key, Object> hints) is not "side effect free" because it mutates the argument object, I BINDINGS is never modified once the class is initialized.
replies.author: groldan

timeline.message:
[GEOT-6506] Unnecessary synchronization in GeoTools.scanForSystemHints()

GeoTools.scanForSystemHints() synchronizes on its static
BINDINGS variable, which is only modified during the class'
static initialization. The method is side-effect free and
only mutates the argument object, hence there's no need
to synchronize on this field.

[GEOT-6506] make the immutability of GeoTools.BINDINGS explicit

GeoTools.BINDINGS is an immutable mapping of System propery names to
RenderingHint.Key. Make it explicit in code and javadocs.
